result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth J Clavey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.  Court grants the defendant 3 days of sentence credit.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth J Clavey

defendant.name: Clavey, Kenneth J
defendant.address: 301 N. Grand St Apt B, Markesan, WI 53946

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:38 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with jail, costs and DNA.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs and defendant has 3 days of sentence credit.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

-5 days county jail, to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-Court grants the defendant 3 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 10:44 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 7, 2017 at 10:30 am.

10:34 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - have talked with the ADA and an agreement has been reached and requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on February 7, 2017 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:35 a.m.
Status hearing on December 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Court adjourned at 10:16 a.m.

Status hearing on April 5, 2016 at 09:15 am.

8:51 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 5, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:53 a.m.
